explain: to trust or rely on someone or something
an overflow of water onto land
a long time with little or no rain
to change behavior so that it is easier to live in a particular place
the group of people, such as a family, that lives in a particular house
a box where letters and packages are delivered to your home
a thin string used to tie a shoe closed
a sport where two teams try to score points by carrying or throwing an oval ball
a bag with two straps that you wear on your back to carry things
statement: The dog depended on its owner for food and water.
depended
The man bumped his toe. His toe is sore.
sore
The cat saw the food. She sprang toward her dish.
sprang
Before getting a puppy, the girl studied a book about dog care.
studied
Too much rain can cause a flood.
flood
The farmers could not grow any corn because of the long drought.
drought
Animals can learn to adapt to their changed environments.
adapt
There are four people living in my household.
household
I found a birthday card in the mailbox from my grandmother.
mailbox
He stopped to tie his shoelace before running the race.
shoelace
The boys played football on the field during recess.
football
She put her books and lunch in her backpack before going to school.
backpack
